title: 107_hr2548
content: Repeal of 1993 increase in tax on Social Security benefits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude paragraph (2) of section 86(a) for taxable years after December 31, 2000. Conforming amendments include changing the percentage in section 871(a) and amending section 121(e)(1) of the Social Security Amendments of 1983. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude certain paragraphs for taxable years after December 31, 2000. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. Additionally, there is a provision for the rebate of 2000 taxes attributable to a 1993 increase. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude certain paragraphs for taxable years after December 31, 2000. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. Additionally, there is a provision for the rebate of 2000 taxes attributable to a 1993 increase in tax on Social Security benefits. In 2001, individuals can claim a tax credit for the difference in tax if a specific section did not apply in 2000. The credit amount is reduced by any refunds or credits received. Failure to reduce the credit results in an error. The tax credit for joint returns in 2000 is based on social security benefits received. The credit is coordinated with estimated tax payments and can be refunded in advance. The tax credit for joint returns in 2000 is based on social security benefits received and can be refunded in advance. The advance refund amount is determined based on the credit allowed for the first taxable year beginning in 2000. Overpayments will be refunded or credited as quickly as possible, with the goal of processing them before October 1, 2001. No interest will be allowed on any refunds or credits after December 31, 2001. In 2001, no interest shall be allowed on any overpayment related to this subsection. A clerical amendment was made to the table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65. "Sec. 6429. Rebate of 2000 taxes attributable to 1993 increase in tax on social security benefits."
